data: It is a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

It contains approximately 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and reports related to Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

It is a dataset designed to understand the sentiment of financial texts. It combines artificial intelligence and semantic web technology to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions within the relevant context.

It integrates entity-sentiment annotations to solve the headline problem, which involves multiple entities potentially carrying conflicting sentiments. It is a dataset of over 10,700 news headlines directly annotated by humans, providing insight into sentiment changes related to specific entities in financial news.

It is a dataset of tokenized and annotated transcripts of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

It is an annotated dataset regarding relationships within financial documents extracted from SEC 10-X reports. It spans approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across 8 entity pairs (e.g., Person-Policy, Institution-Amount). It is useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.

It is a dataset collected from various news sources and evaluated by human experts. It helps researchers explore the impact of news headlines on price changes, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
It is a dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies within text data.

It provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real financial article headlines in 15 languages. It includes annotations for high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

It is a collection of question-answer pairs involving deep analysis of financial reports. Authored by financial experts, it provides training data for answering complex financial questions, focusing on deep reasoning over financial data.
